definitions: Roman goddess of the moon in ancient mythology and religion
Latin and poetic term for Earth's natural satellite or moon
personal name for females derived from the Latin word for moon
examples: Luna was worshipped alongside Sol in ancient Roman temples
The priestesses of Luna performed rituals during full moon nights
The poet wrote of Luna's silver light upon the waves
Ancient astronomers tracked Luna's phases across the celestial sphere
Her parents named her Luna after the beautiful moon
Luna started her new job at the observatory yesterday

definitions: member or adherent of Lutheran churches following Martin Luther's theological teachings
characteristic of or pertaining to Lutheran beliefs, practices, or institutions
examples: The Lutheran attended services at the local evangelical church
Many Lutherans emigrated from Germany to America in the nineteenth century
The Lutheran doctrine emphasizes justification by faith alone
They enrolled their children in the Lutheran elementary school

definitions: branch of Protestant Christianity based on Martin Luther's teachings emphasizing salvation by faith alone
examples: Lutheranism spread rapidly through northern Europe after the Reformation
The core tenets of Lutheranism include sola scriptura and sola fide

definitions: northern constellation representing the lyre of Orpheus containing the bright star Vega
small harp-like stringed instrument used in ancient Greece and medieval Europe
examples: Lyra rises high in the summer sky with Vega as its brightest star
Astronomers can easily locate Lyra near the constellation Cygnus
The musician played a haunting melody on the medieval lyra
Ancient Greek poets often accompanied themselves with a lyra

definitions: flat piece of material for covering floors or surfaces
densely tangled or felted mass of hair, fur, or fibers
protective or functional surface for sports, yoga, or other activities
examples: She wiped her feet on the welcome mat before entering
The bathroom mat absorbed water from the shower
The dog's fur had formed thick mats behind its ears
Years of neglect left the carpet in a matted condition
The wrestlers grappled on the padded competition mat
She unrolled her yoga mat for the morning practice session

definitions: third month of the year in the Gregorian calendar
organized procession or demonstration where people walk together for a cause
frontier or boundary region between territories or countries
rhythmic walking movement especially by soldiers or bands
examples: March brings the first signs of spring to the garden
Her birthday falls on the fifteenth of March
Thousands joined the march for civil rights downtown yesterday
The protest march proceeded peacefully through the city streets
The Welsh Marches formed the border between England and Wales
Medieval lords controlled the march territories along the frontier
The regiment began its march toward the enemy position
The band performed a rousing march during halftime

definitions: Master of Business Administration graduate degree focusing on business management and leadership
examples: She earned her MBA from a top-ranked business school
The job posting requires candidates to have an MBA degree

definitions: synthetic psychoactive substance chemically known as methylenedioxymethamphetamine commonly called ecstasy or molly
examples: MDMA was originally developed as a pharmaceutical compound in 1912
Researchers are studying MDMA for potential therapeutic applications in PTSD treatment

definitions: bibliographic database of life sciences and biomedical information maintained by the National Library of Medicine
examples: Researchers searched Medline for recent studies on diabetes treatment
The systematic review included all relevant articles indexed in Medline

definitions: informal abbreviation for medication or medicine
informal abbreviation for the Mediterranean Sea or region
informal abbreviation for medical field or medical school
examples: Don't forget to take your meds this morning
The pharmacy filled all her meds for the month
They sailed across the Med during their summer vacation
The Med climate is perfect for growing olives
She's planning to apply to med school next year
He works as a technician in the med department

definitions: Master of Fine Arts graduate degree in visual or performing arts
multi-factor authentication security method requiring multiple verification forms
examples: He completed his MFA in creative writing at the university
The gallery features work by recent MFA graduates
The company requires MFA for all employee account logins
Enable MFA to add extra security to your online banking

definitions: megahertz, unit of frequency equal to one million cycles per second
examples: The processor runs at a clock speed of 2400 MHz
Radio stations broadcast on specific MHz frequencies

definitions: Musical Instrument Digital Interface protocol for electronic music equipment communication
clothing or style designation for mid-length items especially skirts or dresses
examples: The keyboard connects to the computer through a MIDI cable
Musicians use MIDI to compose and edit digital music
She wore a floral midi dress to the garden party
The midi skirt falls just below the knee

definitions: Moving Picture Experts Group digital video and audio compression standard format
examples: The video was encoded in MPEG format for streaming
MPEG compression reduces file sizes while maintaining quality

definitions: Magnetic Resonance Imaging medical scanning technology using magnetic fields to create detailed body images
examples: The doctor ordered an MRI to examine the knee injury
MRI scans revealed no abnormalities in the brain tissue

definitions: monosodium glutamate flavor enhancer commonly used in cooking and food processing
abbreviated form of message especially in digital communication contexts
examples: Some people are sensitive to MSG in Chinese food
The ingredient list shows MSG as a flavor enhancer
Send me a msg when you arrive at the airport
I received your msg about the meeting time change

definitions: Mountain Standard Time zone used in parts of North America seven hours behind UTC
examples: The conference call is scheduled for 2 PM MST
Arizona doesn't observe daylight saving time and stays on MST year-round

definitions: Master of Science postgraduate academic degree in scientific or technical fields
Mediterranean Shipping Company or similar maritime shipping line designation
examples: She earned her MSc in computer science from the university
The position requires an MSc in engineering or related field
The cargo ship MSC Oscar is one of the largest container vessels
MSC operates shipping routes across all major global ports

definitions: award given to the best performing player in sports competition or season
basic version of a product with core features for early customer testing
examples: The quarterback won the MVP award for the third consecutive year
She was named MVP of the basketball tournament
The startup launched an MVP to test market demand
We need user feedback on the MVP before adding features

definitions: megawatt hour unit of energy equal to one million watts used continuously for one hour
examples: The wind farm generated 500 MWh of electricity last month
Industrial facilities are charged based on MWh consumption

definitions: tragic play by William Shakespeare about a Scottish general's murderous ambition
theatrical superstition where saying the play's name brings bad luck
examples: Students studied Macbeth in their English literature class
The company performed Macbeth at the summer Shakespeare festival
Actors call it 'the Scottish play' instead of saying Macbeth
Theater tradition says mentioning Macbeth backstage brings misfortune

definitions: medieval weapon with a heavy head on a solid shaft used for combat
ornamental staff carried as a symbol of authority in ceremonies
aromatic spice made from the dried covering of nutmeg seeds
examples: The knight wielded a spiked mace in battle
Medieval maces could crush armor with devastating force
The university president carried the ceremonial mace during graduation
Parliament's golden mace symbolizes the authority of the Speaker
Add a pinch of mace to enhance the pie's flavor
Mace has a more delicate taste than nutmeg

definitions: person from Macedonia or relating to Macedonian culture language or territory
examples: The Macedonian spoke his native language with his family
Macedonian cuisine features many grilled meat dishes

definitions: ratio of an object's speed to the speed of sound in the surrounding medium
examples: The fighter jet flew at Mach 2 over the ocean
Breaking the sound barrier means exceeding Mach 1

definitions: characterized by cunning, scheming, and unscrupulous behavior especially in politics, from Niccolò Machiavelli
examples: His machiavellian tactics helped him rise to power
The CEO's machiavellian approach alienated many employees

definitions: person from Madagascar or relating to the island nation of Madagascar
examples: The Madagascan lemur is found nowhere else on Earth
Madagascan vanilla is prized for its exceptional quality

definitions: the Virgin Mary, mother of Jesus Christ in Christian tradition
artistic representation of the Virgin Mary often with infant Jesus
stage name of influential American pop singer and cultural icon
examples: Catholics pray to the Madonna for intercession and guidance
The faithful gathered at the shrine of the Madonna
The Renaissance Madonna painting hangs in the museum
Raphael created numerous Madonna compositions during his career
Madonna's concert sold out within hours of tickets going on sale
The documentary explored Madonna's influence on pop culture

definitions: organized criminal society originating in Sicily characterized by codes of silence and loyalty
any organized group exercising significant control or influence in a particular sphere
examples: The mafia controlled illegal gambling operations throughout the city
Federal prosecutors finally convicted several mafia bosses
The literary mafia determines which books get published and reviewed
Some call them the Silicon Valley mafia of tech investors

definitions: vivid purplish-red color between red and purple in the color spectrum
examples: She painted her bedroom walls a vibrant magenta
The printer ran out of magenta ink cartridge

definitions: the three wise men who brought gifts to infant Jesus according to Christian tradition
priests or wise men in ancient Persia practicing Zoroastrianism
examples: The magi followed the star to find the newborn king
Children reenacted the journey of the magi in the Christmas pageant
The magi interpreted dreams and advised Persian rulers
Ancient magi were skilled in astronomy and medicine

definitions: Mary's song of praise from the Gospel of Luke often used in Christian liturgy
examples: The choir sang the Magnificat during evening vespers
Bach composed several settings of the Magnificat for church services

definitions: ancient Sanskrit epic poem of India describing the Kurukshetra War and containing philosophical teachings
examples: The Mahabharata contains the famous Bhagavad Gita dialogue
Scholars study the Mahabharata for insights into ancient Indian society

definitions: major branch of Buddhism emphasizing universal liberation and the bodhisattva ideal
examples: Mahayana Buddhism spread throughout East Asia from India
The Mahayana tradition includes Zen and Pure Land schools

definitions: prophesied redeemer in Islam who will restore justice before the Day of Judgment
examples: Some Muslims believe the Mahdi will appear alongside Jesus
Various historical figures have claimed to be the Mahdi

definitions: envelope or packaging designed for sending items through postal service
software program or system that sends email or postal mail
person or business that sends bulk mail or packages
examples: Use a padded mailer to protect fragile items during shipping
The promotional mailer arrived in yesterday's mail
The email mailer automatically sends newsletters to subscribers
Configure the mailer settings to use your SMTP server
The bulk mailer sent thousands of catalogs each month
Online retailers are major mailers during the holiday season

definitions: commissioned military officer rank above captain and below lieutenant colonel
primary field of study chosen by a college or university student
something of greater importance, seriousness, or significance
examples: The major commanded a battalion of infantry soldiers
She was promoted from captain to major last year
His major in computer science prepared him for a tech career
Students must declare a major by their junior year
The company announced a major restructuring of its operations
Climate change remains a major concern for coastal communities

definitions: person skilled in using a bow and arrow for sport or hunting
person born under the zodiac sign Sagittarius represented by an archer
examples: The archer drew her bow and aimed at the target
Medieval archers were crucial in many historic battles
As an archer, she's naturally optimistic and adventurous
The archer sign falls between November and December

definitions: northernmost region of Earth surrounding the North Pole including the Arctic Ocean
characterized by extremely cold temperatures or conditions
examples: Polar bears hunt seals across the Arctic ice sheets
Climate change is rapidly warming the Arctic region
An arctic blast brought record low temperatures to the midwest
She wore arctic gear to protect against the freezing wind

definitions: federal republic in southern South America known for tango, beef, and wine
examples: Argentina won the FIFA World Cup three times
Buenos Aires is the capital city of Argentina

definitions: person from Argentina or relating to Argentina and its culture
examples: The Argentinian author won the international literary prize
Argentinian beef is famous for its exceptional quality

definitions: southwestern state of the United States known for the Grand Canyon and desert landscapes
examples: Arizona attracts millions of tourists to the Grand Canyon annually
Phoenix is the capital and largest city of Arizona

definitions: large boat built by Noah to save life from the biblical flood
sacred chest containing the tablets of Jewish law
place of refuge or safety
examples: Noah built the ark according to God's specific instructions
The ark carried two of every animal during the flood
The Ark of the Covenant was kept in the Temple
Indiana Jones searched for the lost ark
The wildlife sanctuary serves as an ark for endangered species
The library became an ark preserving knowledge through dark times

definitions: prophesied final battle between good and evil at the end of the world
any catastrophic or extremely destructive conflict or confrontation
examples: The Book of Revelation describes Armageddon as the ultimate battle
Some believe Armageddon will occur at Megiddo in Israel
Nuclear war could trigger an environmental armageddon
The trade war threatened economic armageddon for both nations

definitions: landlocked country in the South Caucasus region between Europe and Asia
examples: Armenia was the first nation to adopt Christianity as state religion
Yerevan has been the capital of Armenia since ancient times

definitions: person from Armenia or relating to Armenian culture, language, or ethnicity
examples: The Armenian community preserves its ancient cultural traditions
She's learning Armenian to connect with her heritage

definitions: organized military land force of a nation equipped for fighting on land
large organized group of people united for a particular purpose
examples: The army deployed troops to the conflict zone
She served in the army for twenty years
An army of volunteers helped with disaster relief efforts
The company hired an army of consultants for the project

definitions: island country in the southern Caribbean Sea near the coast of Venezuela
examples: Aruba attracts tourists with its white sand beaches and clear waters
The official languages of Aruba include Dutch and Papiamento

definitions: act of rising or moving upward especially into the sky or heaven
Jesus Christ's bodily rising to heaven forty days after resurrection
rise to a higher rank, status, or level of importance
examples: The hot air balloon's ascension thrilled the watching crowd
Scientists tracked the rocket's ascension through the atmosphere
Christians celebrate the Ascension forty days after Easter
The Ascension is depicted in many religious paintings
Her ascension to CEO surprised many industry observers
The prince's ascension to the throne occurred after his father's death

definitions: Earth's largest continent containing diverse countries from Japan to Turkey
examples: Asia contains more than half of the world's population
The Silk Road connected Asia with Europe for centuries

definitions: person from Asia or relating to Asian countries, peoples, or cultures
examples: Asian cuisine includes incredibly diverse cooking traditions
The Asian financial markets opened with strong gains
